result.execSummary:
The defendant Marissa L Ballard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marissa L Ballard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RESTITUTION
Bail refund check packet
3/9/16 restitution notice mailed to victim.

Defendant Marissa L Ballard in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 12 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $546.56 to Wilfredo R.; cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES; cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Appeal rights given.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marissa L Ballard in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 210.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marissa L Ballard in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for bail/bond hearing.  The defendant is out of custody.  Defense is in receipt of discovery and needs additional time to review it with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

01-07-2016

Attorney Kevin Brian Dunn in court, defendant Marissa L Ballard not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Brian Dunn in court by phone, defendant Marissa L Ballard not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel was not aware that he was appointed on this matter and is no longer in the courthouse.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A-1 Beauty located at 3514 W. Fond du Lac Avenue, Wilfredo Rivera and Jovan Vance.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marissa L Ballard in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Marissa L Ballard in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.  vp

Attorney Edgar Lin for Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered the previously issued bench warrant to remain in effect.  Case was scheduled for jury trial today.  The State had 3 citizen witnesses and 3 police officers present in court.  Court is requesting high cash bail upon return of the warrant at a minimum of $2000.00 cash.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court earlier.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 

NOTE:  Court recommends high cash bail upon return of the warrant.  Case remain calendare for jury trial on October 7, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Marissa L Ballard in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
